bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.p: This program lists events and speakers for the dedication of Walter Reed's birthplace.

div1.head: Program: Belroi Dedication, October 15, 1927
div1.p:
The Opening of Belroi, the Birthplace of Walter Reed, and
Its Dedication as a National Shrine.
Belroi, Gloucester County, Virginia, Saturday, October 15, 1927.
Exercises Commencing at 2:00 P. M. Sharp.

list.item: 1 The Star Spangled Banner--Fort Eustis Band, United States Army.

2 Devotional--Rev. O. J. Haga, Pastor Gloucester Circuit, M. E. Church,
South, Belroi, Va.

3 Introductory Remarks--Dr. Edward C. S. Taliaferro, Chairman Walter
Reed Memorial Commission, Norfolk, Va.

4 Remarks--The History of the Walter Reed Memorial--Dr. Clarence Porter
Jones, Secretary and Treasurer, Walter Reed Memorial Commission, New-
port News, Va.

5 The Woman's Part in the Walter Reed Memorial--Mrs. William Fleet Tal-
iaferro, President Gloucester County Woman's Club, Nuttall, Va.
6 Music--Fort Eustis Band, United States Army.
7 Remarks--Introducing Dr. Royster--Dr. D. O.J. D. Clements , Ordinary, Va.

8 What Walter Reed Means to Medical Research--Dr. Lawrence T. Royster,
Vice-President, Medical Society of Virginia, Professor of Pediatrics, Uni-
versity of Virginia.
9 Music--Fort Eustis Band, United States Army.

10 Remarks--Introducing Col. Kean--Hon. Schuyler Otis Bland, House of
Representatives, First Virginia District, Newport News, Va.

11 Walter Reed as a World Hero--Colonel Jefferson Randolph Kean, M. C.,
United States Army, retired, Editor The Military Surgeon, Washington,
D. C.

12 Benediction--Rev. James C. Reed, D. D., member Virginia Conference, M.
E. Church, South, (a brother of Walter Reed) Blackstone, Va.

div1.p:
From one11 to two12 o'clock, a fleet of airships from Langley Field will be over
Gloucester County, Belroi in particular.

One of the Fort Eustis Bands, United States Army, will furnish the music. A
concert will be given at or shortly before one-thirty o'clock.

The Walter Reed Memorial Commission of the Medical Society of Virginia, for
the Encouragement of Research, which holds title to the property con-
sists of the following: Dr. E. C. S. Taliaferro, Chairman, Norfolk; Dr.
Clarence Porter Jones, Secretary and Treasurer, Newport News; Dr.
Greer Baughman, Richmond; Dr. Halstead S. Hedges, Charlottesville;
Dr. Garnett Nelson, Richmond.
The Woman's Club of Gloucester County will have the custody of the property.
The Belroi Commission of this Club consists of the following:
